intro: Eudesmis fascicularis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf eudesmia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Eudesmis fascicularis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
